website_summaries.verdict: An attractive hydroponics unit that can be easily used indoors or out.
pros: Comes with 6 quarts of growing medium (Fiber Soil) to anchor roots
Has a foolproof water level indicator
Solidly made, with a nice look
cons: Some reports that this option arrived missing parts
You'll have to add your own fertilizer/plant food to keep the plants healthy
The Fiber Soil can get moldy

customer_reviews.title: The bad reviews our largely in part to gardening ignorance. This is a great hydroponic planter.
customer_reviews.text: I was cautious at first due to negative reviews, but under more careful examination found that the people leaving bad reviews were simply not using the planter correctly. Some people planted the wrong herbs next to each other, others claimed that the planter/soil killed their plant. Coconut fiber soil is great, but doesn’t provide the necessary nutrients to sustain a plant by itself. You need to add the right plant food to accompany your herbs of choice. I personally mixed mine with potting soil and slow release nutrients. Months later, and everything is thriving.
customer_reviews.author: Julien

customer_reviews.title: Good looking indoor planter
customer_reviews.text: I have historically not been successful at gardening, so I ordered this planter to make things easy on myself. A few weeks after planting seeds I have a number of basil, parsley, and sage sprouts. The planter looks great in my window and I love how easy maintenance is since I rarely have to water. My only issue was that the soil that comes with the planter is not fertilized at all, so you need to make sure there is some kind of plant food situation happening. Other than that, it's pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Get Ready for Winter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our daughters BDay as she always comes around and wants some our herbs to take home, and we wanted her to have her own "garden" in her apartment in Manhattan - - we planted it up and watched the herbs thriving and then thought "Hey, why not bring our herbs indoors during the Winter and plant them in one of these WindowGardens ?" This is perfect for that !
customer_reviews.author: WK

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: I planted a couple of herbs in this planter and so far it really has been great. The soil seems to sense the amount of moisture the plants needed without over watering. I looks very nice and I can easily see when to add more water.
customer_reviews.author: Diana P

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Two months into owning this and my herbs have suffered the entire time. It would simply be better if the planter had an inner planter and an outer saucer that you could easily look at and see if the plants needed water. As for the fiber soil that provides the plants with 3x more oxygen than traditional soil?? Well if that is true, it would seem that plants don't care about how much oxygen they get. Save your money and don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: MAL

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Killed all herbs. Water indicator not working.
customer_reviews.text: I placed 4 small herbs in this garden tub and within one week the dill has dried out and died. I have not noticed the water indicator dropping at all which I'm concerned about - is it working properly? Update: ALL herbs have died in a short period of time. The water indicator failed to do it's job and I did not hear back from the seller from my previous concerned post. I'm so disappointed. What a waste of money and now I have to buy all new herbs.
customer_reviews.author: Mama2018

customer_reviews.title: This looked great in front of the window when the herbs were ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my mom who wanted some fresh herbs in the kitchen. This looked great in front of the window when the herbs were fresh and looking good. However, I went back to visit a few weeks later and all of the herbs were looking dry and dreary. I was very disappointed when I saw this, since this was supposed to be a self watering tub. We are not sure if the plants themselves were not the best or if the tub wasn't working correctly, so my mom has plans to replant new ones and try again. I will update my review when she does!
customer_reviews.author: Kacie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for amateurs or forgetful people
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were clear and easy to follow. Set up was simple, and it really helps that it comes with fiber soil included. I'm new to gardening or even having house plants, and I'm bad at watering consistently...it's either too much or too little/too often or not often enough. This planter is self watering so I don't have to guess wrong. I just have to fill the reservoir and wait until it needs refilling. All I needed were the herb seeds and some miracle grow! Hoping to see some sprouts soon.
customer_reviews.author: Claire A

customer_reviews.title: Glass in the dirt pallets!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because my nice and nephew and i missed gardening, and i wanted it to be a project that brings us together. there are glass shards in the 'soil' it comes with, so needless to say that got tossed as soon as i saw my nephew (mixing the dirt with his hands as per instruction) get scratched. i then attempted to use it with other soil, but it's too tall and when filling the water tank and then adding the wet dirt the soil stayed too moist overall and so i tossed it. I immediately emailed the seller and to this day i have no reply!!!! Outrageous.
customer_reviews.author: Andreea

customer_reviews.title: Great as long as you know what you're doing
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my window. I had herbs thrive and others die off fast. Here are my personal learnings: 1) Pair up plants that grow well with each other 2) Water normally (instead of relying on self-watering) for the first month 3) Pay attention to how much sun your planter will actually get vs. what your herb needs The planter is great overall and very sturdy. I ended up using half of the included soil and half potting mix, as suggested by another commenter, which ended up doing really well.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndarra

customer_reviews.title: Bumpy start
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together, it fit 4 different medium sized herb plants very nicely, the fiber soil fluffed up very well with the warm water, mixed it with herb food fertilizer, the process was very simple BUT using the garden rub how it was outlined in the instructions all of the herbs died, none of them flourished so had to dump everything out. Then my mother used it with her herbs, planting them how she would plant her garden in Poland and all of her herbs are thriving and massively growing! I’d say if you have a green thumb stick to what you know.
customer_reviews.author: Paola

customer_reviews.title: My herbs are going wild
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these tubs, set them up using the clear instructions, filled them with herbs, and now, a couple of weeks later, all six plants are thriving. I love being able to leave them over a weekend or even longer without worrying about watering. Tonight my husband is using a bunch of thyme to make dinner, which is good because the thyme is threatening to crowd out the rosemary and oregano. So wonderful to have fresh herbs in a city apartment.
customer_reviews.author: kitcross

customer_reviews.title: 5 star product all the way around
customer_reviews.text: A lot better than expected. Fit great on kitchen window sill. I'll try it for a couple of weeks but I'm already thinking of buying another one. Looks great very pretty. Great value for the price. I'm wondering so I'll have to do research if they have bigger pots. I'll buy them if they do. I asked a question before I purchased the product and they answered immediately.
customer_reviews.author: KWright

customer_reviews.title: Plants died and infested with bugs
customer_reviews.text: My plants died and replaced with 3 new ones. The plant keep dying and I tried to maintain reasonable water level. But for water the reason, the water smells bad even after I drain and replace with fresh water. The standing water causes bug infestation too. I believe it must be the design or the article dust that came with the pot. I have another single pot of similar design and it was ok.
customer_reviews.author: MicT

customer_reviews.title: Great planter, bad soil
customer_reviews.text: I would say don't use the soil that comes with it. I followed all of the directions and any plant I tried to transfer in died. I switched to general potting soil with some extra fertilizer mixed in and everything is growing great. The planter itself is well made. I've bought a few sub-irrigated planters at this point. This has been the best looking and best made for the price. I'd recommend it. Just ditch the soil that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rex B.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I bought this my herbs that were barley hanging in there have started looking so much healthier. The dead Browning leaves have turned green and fuller.
customer_reviews.author: william goboff

customer_reviews.title: Great great pot!
customer_reviews.text: I first discovered these self-watering planters at a garden show and I have purchased a few more through amazon. I love them. This herb planter is great! Bigger than I expected for some reason but I prefer that. There is actually enough room to grow big bunches of herbs, enough to keep growing AND eating :) I only have parsley and basil in mine and keep it in a window for ample sunlight. Very easy to do with the included fiber soil so you don’t have to go behind the shed and dig through the snow for your half-used bag of potting soil :)
customer_reviews.author: LlamaMama

customer_reviews.title: After months, herbs are still alive
customer_reviews.text: Herbs love this pot. They are growing like crazy. Perfect for herbs that have deep roots like basil, oregano, mint....not good for thyme. Thyme needs a less deep pot. Don’t have to worry about under or over watering. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking container
customer_reviews.text: It's a good looking, well made planter. It comes with 3 coco coir disks that are enough to fill the container. The only problem is the fill point for the reservoir. It is a very small space below the water gauge, so water will have to be poured in very slowly. Otherwise water will spill out and swamp the coco coir. Still, there aren't that many options for self watering containers with water level indicators, so it's still a good option for the price.
customer_reviews.author: B C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Received mine and so far, so good. Easy instructions and everything seems to be working properly. I'll probably be ordering more! UPDATE - After a year of use, I decided to repot and start over with new herbs. Unfortunately, during the process I misplaced a plug that holds water in the bottom. I called the company, spoke directly with one of the owners and she is sending me out a replacement plug at no charge. You just can't ask for better service than that! Buying stuff online can be a hit or miss proposition, but this company is a real gem. You can definitely order from them with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Legend87

customer_reviews.title: Worked initially
customer_reviews.text: I love this in concept and it worked ok initially, but now the sensor gets stuck so I can never tell when I need to water, which is why I bought this in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: L. Le

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money! I had high hopes for this but it was awful. My herbs rotted and started growing mold within the first week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lose of plants
customer_reviews.text: Actually didn't use it myself, it was a bday gift for my mom and she loved it at first but then the plants she transferred into it died so shes less of a fan now. It sounds useful but im not sure all plants are created equal & can survive the constant water.
customer_reviews.author: John Schwab

customer_reviews.title: meh...
customer_reviews.text: Water gauge is super problematic. It will read full for days and than all of the sudden hit bottom. This often results in the soil being too moist or too dry. Loved the idea of this, but it just doesn't work as well as you would hope.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Genghis Khan

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to get this to transfer my Vietnamese corianders from my garden to indoor before the winter arrives. The tubs works and I only need to refill the water every two weeks. I live in New York.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Soil will get moldy and will kill plants
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this. It did not work. I followed all the instruction but soil still got moldy and killed 5 plants. I do not Recommanded this.
customer_reviews.author: Elmira Azar

customer_reviews.title: Good planters
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically to transplant herbs from my greenhouse and bring them inside at the start of winter. These planters are working great so far. Nice and deep so I could move the entire roots of the plants. I did not use much of the fiber soil - mainly some in the bottom and then around the soil moved with the plants. All the plants survived the transplants are starting to get new growths. I love the self watering feature with the notification when water needs to be refilled. I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent planter and soil for growing herbs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this planter to grow basil on our lanai in Florida. Having gone thru the process of buying small plants at the grocery store and planting them in pots, I never achieved satisfactory results, so I decided to try this product. It is very simple and the synthetic soil works amazingly well with the plants from the grocery store. The watering gauge is simple and effective. After two weeks, my plants are flourishing and I am extremely pleased with the results. An excellent product to grow herbs or other plants. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Don St A

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought another
customer_reviews.text: Great product, my basil and rosemary are doing excellent. Such a good product, I bought another one for dill / mint to grow in. Never have to worry about under or over watering. Just fill the reservoir every few days.
customer_reviews.author: Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these self watering pots
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful item, quick to assemble. It's a one stop shop if you have some seedlings that need a real home!! These are wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy DuBois

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This planter is beautiful. Easy to put together. However, approximately 1/2 day from adding the plants and water, it began leaking. I am so disappointed. I will keep it and find a work around, but it did not meet the need. It was perfect for 8 hours. BTW: I did remove and reinstall the plug a couple of times. It still leaked, even with a few drops of water in the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Readsallthetime

customer_reviews.title: The containers crack and leak water
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of this planters and they leaked. I thought maybe it was because some of the water was spilling when i was pouring it in until i realized that BOTH the planters are cracked at the same spot. Clearly a production mistake, but now there is nothing i can do since i no longer have the boxes they arrived on to return them
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: takes out the guess work
customer_reviews.text: My Basil and Rosemary are thriving. they drink A LOT but I dont have to worry about over or under watering, I just watch the little valve
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product...solid value
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly excellent product. It is extremely well made with clear and simple instructions. I have lots of southern exposure windows and decided to order two. I planted radishes and scallions....they are growing fabulously well. After 2 weeks, I ordered 3 more units to grow micro greens and herbs. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Val Lete

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all!
customer_reviews.text: It's been 6 weeks now. Only a few scattered slivers of green. Soil gets moldy easily. Virtually nothing happened. Sat on counter in front of window that gets 6-8 hours of daily sunlight. Kept it hydrated as required with water measuring gauge. Did not over water. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Parry J. Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: My gardening thumb is black not green so I was excited to get this self-watering planter to have fresh herbs in my kitchen. Looks great sitting out and doesn't take up much room. One thing to know - there's a piece of foam that's part of the water meter which I threw away thinking it was packaging. The company was very helpful and mailed me a new piece to fix my mistake
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: It's great looking and makes watering very convenient! Our windowsill is a little small so it unfortunately didn't fit, but we still love it
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Great planter
customer_reviews.text: Product comes in a very well package box. Really easy to set up with very clear instructions. My little plants are already starting to grow. Lightweight. It also has an easy area for you to refill the water
customer_reviews.author: Casie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love these planters. Even come with soil. Very sturdy and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Mena

customer_reviews.title: In about 12 weeks I will have beautiful flowers growing in this planter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for herbs but decided to put paper white bulbs in it for Christmas. In about 12 weeks I will have beautiful flowers growing in this planter. Not having to worry about watering is a blessing. I LOVE this planter!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon m Gillette-Greene

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for basil
customer_reviews.text: I grew three types of basil together (italian, holy, thai sweet) and it worked perfectly. The only minor complaint I have is that you have refill the reservoir very slowly because water easily splashes out.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Great product! awesome gift!
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! I can’t wait to start my indoor herbal garden! The best part? It comes with soil! I will post picks once my basil, Thyme and mint grow!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for herbs.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy for a first time grower who does not have a green thumb, sits on the window sill, a nice clean look.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Everything is right in the Box
customer_reviews.text: Everything needed is right in the box and easy to set up. Love growing my own flavor intense herbs without the need for pesticides.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great Mothers Day gift - good quality and perfect style!
customer_reviews.author: denise pircher

customer_reviews.title: Works okay.
customer_reviews.text: Plants grow okay but white mildew or mold is growing on coco fibers
customer_reviews.author: I buy lots of stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great herb garden planter
customer_reviews.text: This window garden box is wonderful. Makes growing veggies very simple and a whole lot less work! Using this planter has saved me money from buying herbs from the store only to use a little then it goes bad. It's nice just snipping off what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Danae D

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to set up and it comes with complete instructions
customer_reviews.text: My Aqua phobic Herb Garden Tub is everything I was looking for and more. It is very easy to set up and it comes with complete instructions. It is a perfect size and very easy to maintain. I ordered the color white and I love it, because it can go with anything.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaA

customer_reviews.title: I love this herb garden tub
customer_reviews.text: I love this herb garden tub , it’s quite large , very nice finish , easy instructions and compliments any room of the house . Definitely will recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Easy Planter for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Love the planter. Sometimes it seems as if the water indicator is a bit off but nevertheless perfect for a small window sill and bad planter like me.
customer_reviews.author: Donada Francis

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Did not include the 6 qt of Fiber Soil as states on product description or ob box.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Borruso

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy instructions . We are using it for our herbs.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Schechter-Grimaldi

customer_reviews.title: No green thumb needed!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! The plant we put in there has never grown that much when it was in a normal pot. Impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Fauteux

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and manage. I also recommend using a "grow light" to speed up the process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom and she loved it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Moldy potting medium.
customer_reviews.text: While the concept and the actual planter seem to work fine, the potting material sprouted mold as well as my seedlings. Unfortunately, the seedlings were overwhelmed by the mold. Now I will have to buy new seeds as well as a different potting medium.
customer_reviews.author: Merm2Three

customer_reviews.title: It seemed incomplete
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift. I wish it had included seeds!
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth schembri

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Supposed to be self watering but it is defective
customer_reviews.author: H Peters

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful planter. I wanted to order one more (White) but unfortunately now is out of stock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the white. I’m the kind of person who loves to have plants in my house. The planter looks nice by my kitchen window. I planted parsley and cilantro. Love it ....
customer_reviews.author: Rahat

customer_reviews.title: Needs alteration
customer_reviews.text: Worked only after I lined the inner bottom seam with silicone to prevent leakage.
customer_reviews.author: Michele O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: Great planter!
customer_reviews.text: Indicator works well to let you know when plants need to be watered. Great planter!
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Wood

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love it great quality works well and the water level stick is most efficient thank you
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Vegan Cook or a Green Thumber
customer_reviews.text: I got this planter as a gift for my girlfriend and she really loves it! If you're a Vegan cook or have a green thumb, I think you would really enjoy this tub, works very well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Desi

customer_reviews.title: Love these planters
customer_reviews.text: Love these planters. I ordered 3 for my large herb window garden. All herbs are happy and the style and quality are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried and tried with this thing and it simply doesn't work. I carefully loaded it with the planting medium and planted basil and parley. The basil lasted less than a week and the parsley two weeks. The basil turned brown with the indicator all the way up for full water. For the parsley, half of the leaves turned brown (not enough water) and the other half turned yellow (too much water). I threw it away. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stroklund

customer_reviews.title: Great idea bit too soggy for indoor herbs
customer_reviews.text: Great idea bit too soggy for indoor herbs, now is on back porch since needs enough sun to combat the moisture. Good looking and love the dirt substance that came with it. Is attractive too. Just too expensive for what ended up not being able to be used indoors that is why only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ang mora

product_meta.title: Window Garden Aquaphoric Herb Garden Tub - Self Watering Planter + Fiber Soil, Keeps Indoor Kitchen Herbs Fresh and Growing for Weeks on Your Home Windowsill. Compact, Attractive and Foolproof.
feature_bullets: ***CHECK OUT OUR STORE! - Click on the blue Window Garden link at top of page*** FRESH HERBS – Grocery store herbs only last a few days in a conventional planter. Now you can enjoy fresh herbs on your windowsill or counter top when you need them, they’ll last for weeks in the Aquaphoric Herb Planter Tub. Herbs are not included in this listing but they’re easy to get, most grocery stores sell them.
PLANTS LIVE LONGER – The unique passive hydroponic action creates the perfect balance of root zone water and oxygen, allowing plants to grow healthier and flourish.

FOOLPROOF – It’s self-watering! The handy water level indicator let’s you know when and how much to water you’re indoor herbs and house plants. Watering is reduced to weeks instead of days. Aquaphoric Planters work great for all plant types, flowers, herbs vegetables, tropical foliage, succulents and seed starting.

ROOTS BREATH, PLANTS FLOURISH – Includes 6 quarts of Fiber Soil. Superior growing medium because roots breath better so plants thrive. Fiber Soil contains minimal nutrients, you’ll need some fertilizer to keep your herb garden growing lush and vibrant.

GREAT GARDENING GIFT - Houseplants and especially herbs are good for you, plus they look great. Why not give the power of plants to someone you care about? It’s easy to grow plants with an Aquaphoric planter. Anyone can do it.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars201 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
